lexicon.gloss: hunt game (by flushing the game while hunters wait in ambush)
lust for, desire (e.g. ʔa-zâŋ ʔa-fok 'his penis erects, i.e. the penis desires sth.')
feed by putting a handful into the mouth
temple of head, side of head
compress (as cloth in a box), press down, crowd
powdered, fine (as sugar, salt, etc.), also fâaŋ dip 'well-pounded millet'
shadow (e.g. by a big tree to a small one)
grain, clf. for seed, unit (for money)
sag, hang low (as skirt), long (as sleeve)
fat (between bowels and the walls of the belly)
cut off, cut out the flesh or skin
secret exit (of a mouse or a rat), backdoor
lick (used for fire or flame only)
use, used to, be in the habit of (aux. verb)
hold something in mouth (e.g. sweets, tobacco)
mouth, beak, lip, tip (e.g. of a pen)
peel off, skin, strip off, unroof
drink or eat semi-liquid food (e.g. porridge)
roll, twist , unite (as fibers into a rope)
unhusked or unpounded rice or millet
clench or clasp in the fist
bank (of a river) side (of a road), shore (of an ocean)
span, bridge across (as a rod on the beam)
hard, be sturdy, be tough, strong, stiff
peel (by taking off cover), e.g. banana, peanuts
scab, dry crust (e.g. hnap khîr 'dry nasal mucus')
bang (as cloth on the wall), thresh (as grain), flap (as wings)
bore, drill, dig up, to make hole
cover, place things upside down or with concavity downwards (as basket, pot, etc.)
travel (to a distance) and return the same day
chief, lord (only in names, e.g. Lal Ceu, meaning "shining chief")
yard (measurement: one fingertip from the other)
proceed, continue on (as in a journey)
young divorced woman or young widow
overflow, go out of sight, disappear
evaginate (as skin), curl up, turn inside out (as skin)
roll up, curl up (used mainly for hair)
roll about (on the floor), wallow (in the mud)
trap of beam or log which is set up to fall when an animal passes underneath
extinct (as species), go out (as light), be extinguished (as fire)
shadow of something (as when the sun is blocked, e.g. by a mountain)
die unnecessarily (as by drowning), be wasted (e.g. of food, etc.)
do something while doing something else
spread, stretch out (as a blanket on the ground)
pull away (as support from underneath), to cut off (as a water source
lever, tip up, lift up one's end
sprinkle (as salt on meat, curry, etc)
bury, inter, immerge, be covered with (middle voice)
come out, emerge, bulge (e.g. eyes), protrude
opposite, the other side (of a river)
ruined (overripe fruit), to have lost its essence (as liquor)
post, put s.th. on the wall
shovel, scrape (as a bird on the ground)
skillful, be adroit, to know how
droop (as a cock's comb, or cow's ears)
intonation, accent, the fall of the sound
rescind, deter, change one's mind to act
full, complete, attain to, reach (a standard)
slip out, fall (e.g. food out of table)
herd, graze (as flock of animals), to be at leisure, to be at freedom
time, occasion, at the time of
stay, spend the night or time at a place
north, upper part, higher up position
appear, emerge, come out, rise (as the sun)
inside, during ("within a time span"), within, household ("insiders")
close, close up (as a cut or crack)
grate, break into pieces (as pounded rice)
lift, elevate, hold in hand (after lifting)
peck (as a fowl), bite (as a snake)
mane (of a horse), bristles (of a pig)
light (e.g. candle, lamp), shine (strictly used for moon)
encircle, to make ring (as with rope on the ground)
have wales, have stripes on the skin
spread, hang things in the sun
thread or strand (as of hair or cotton)
strectch or suspend (as rope), spread (as net)
tip (of vegetable), sprout, new shoot, top (of a tree), edge (of a branch)
oblong or oval figure (as the shape of an egg)
align to, be in line with
follow (as road, river), walk on (as rope)
handle (as of a spoon or cup)
scream, call, out, cry out, shout
cry out (in fear or in pain)
dry or give heat (as fire to wet cloth)
confine (as meat, rice in a pot), be hot due to being confined in an enclosure
